rooms.intro: To start the game, type: go to intro

...you are in Professor Kraysee's office and you wait for him to call you up.
The nervousness rises with each second passing.
Will this be my last hour as a student of the university of Bremen?...
type in 'look around' to get details of the room.
type in 'ready' if you already played the tutorial.
rooms.descri:
professor Kraysee's office looks like it hasn't been tidied up for over a decade. You can see alot of interesting things laying around in his office but nothing all too useful.
He looks at you and you begin to chat...
type in 'talk to professor' to talk to a person

objects.lookAt:
You are now standing in front of the door.
Type in 'open door' to exit the office.

triggers.accept:
You walk out of the room.

Yes! We did it! I’m so glad the Professor gave me a second chance! Or should I say third? Well, this doesn’t matter. Actually, let’s take a look at the notes he handed me.

type in 'look at notes' to inspect an item or object.

You receive some notes.

Player: Thank you Professor! I will not disappoint you, I promise!
type in 'go to door' to go to the exit.

You take a look at the notes.
You manage to read the notes, even though your eyes are watery and your Professors handwriting is awful, to say the least.


'Go to the elephant monument in the Nelson-Mandela-Park,
there you will have to find a hidden box.
Once you found it, you will have to solve a riddle.
If you manage to solve the riddle I will contact you.
Good luck, you will need it.'

- Kraysee

There’s nothing on the back of the paper. But there’s a stain on the bottom of the front page.
You taste it.
Chocolate.

Ugh. I hate chocolate! Professor Kraysee always eats lots and lots of chocolate, no wonder there are stains on every paper we receive…

Type in 'ready' to start your journey.

Professor Kraysee: … I’ve told you, this was your last chance! You already cheated once on your bachelor thesis.
Player: But Professor Kraysee, I really need my degree!
Professor Kraysee: I know that. And I also know that I would ruin your life if I would make you fail. But I need to follow the rules.
Player: …
Player’s eyes getting wet..
Professor Kraysee: Alright, look I may have a task for you. I give you a very last chance for your bachelor thesis. I choose the topic and I conduct your research. If you successfully complete what I ask for I will let you pass. This way you will get your degree even though you cheated. But this will be a difficult tasks and I’m not sure whether you will be able to do it or not.
Player: Please please please. I will do anything!
Not literally!
Professor Kraysee: Alright, here you have some notes. If you solve this riddle I will give you the chance to start your quest.
Type in 'pick up notes' to pick up or receive an item.
You are now standing in front of the elephant monument in the Nelson Mandela Park. Your task is to find the hidden box to solve the riddle the professor gave you.

rooms.intro: You are now standing in front of the elephant monument in the Nelson Mandela Park. Your task is to find the hidden box to solve the riddle the professor gave you.
rooms.descri: There is a bench, a trash bin and a strange looking bush near the monument. You also notice a small staircase leading below the base of the monument.

items.pickUp: You manage to get the bottle out of the trash bin. Your hand's really itchy and you really want to wash your hands now.

objects.lookAt: The bench is covered by moss and bird s***... It hasn’t been used in some time. The paint has almost fallen off. This is not the place professor Kraysee would hide something.
The trash bin is full of … well... trash. Who would have thought? But wait! A PET bottle! Easy money, if you can stand getting it out with your bare hands…
You go down the staircase. In front of you is a door.
The door looks old and rusty, with colonial time decorations and emblems engraved into it.

triggers.accept: You didn't even look around yet. Finding the box like this seems impossible.

triggers.fail: You try to open the door but it's locked.

triggers.accept: You hit the door with all your force! But unfortunately nothing happens.

rooms.intro: You walk for a bit, away from the monument to reach the bush. You look at this strange, suspicious looking odd bush! Do you want to take a closer look?
rooms.descri:
You are standing in front of the bush.
All of a sudden there’s a mother with her child, the child says 'Mami mami there's a guy in the bush'.
You look at them and shout: 'Hey that’s my bush! Look for your own!!' with some irony in your voice. The mother pulls her child away and goes further away from you.
Now you have time to inspect the location closely. You notice that there is a hidden object. It almost looks like a box. Could this be the item the professor wanted me to find?

items.lookAt: It is a tiny piece of paper with random numbers on it. You should take it. Maybe they will be important in the future.
items.pickUp:
You pick up the piece of paper inside the box and read it.
629387445
That’s a lot of numbers. What does this have to do with the 4-digit code? Maybe there is something special about these numbers.

objects.lookAt:
The box is secured with tape that contains the words “It’s prime time!” repeated multiple times written all over it.
The word prime stands out with a blue color.

triggers.accept:
Inside the box is a piece of paper with a riddle drawn on it, an old T9 mobile phone and a GPS device.
You pick up the GPS device and mobile phone. Bonkers!
But what now? Does the phone even work?
triggers.fail: You feel like there is nothing more to the box. The riddle was solved and you already have the phone and GPS device.

triggers.accept:
You start the old phone. To activate the phone you need a 4-digit pin.
Maybe the piece of paper can help?
triggers.fail: There is no other phone around to start, at least not yet.

rooms.intro:
You are making your way downtown.
...
You arrive at the Schlachte flea market.
rooms.descri:
There are dozens and dozens of little stands with people selling anything you could imagine. From trash to very nice and expensive coats to various paintings.
You have a closer look at one of the stands and an ancient treasure chest catches your eye. You take the chest to gain a better view. The salesman looks at you.

objects.lookAt: It is an ancient treasure chest. It magically attracts you.

triggers.accept:
You look around for a good way to run off, but the market is way too crowded for you to flee.
You decide against stealing the chest.
triggers.fail: You already tried doing that, can't you remember?

triggers.accept: You try to put the chest back on the table but a magic force stops you from doing it. You really want this chest.

Player: Yo! How much you want for that ol' wooden box, Mister?
The salesman: 50 bucks.
Player: FIFTY BUCKS?!? mumbling This thing ain't even worth 5 bucks..
The salesman: What was that?
Player: Nothing.
Player: ...

You should try to bargain. Maybe he will lower the price if you ask nice enough.

Do you want to bargain naughty or nicely?
triggers.fail: You already asked him. Better not make him too angry.

triggers.accept:
Player: Hey Mister, look, I don't have enough money to buy your chest. But I have different skills to make up for the money I can't give you.
*You smile at the salesman*
The Salesman seems kinda confused and ignores your approach.
*You look very sad*
triggers.fail: You already asked him. Better not make him too angry.

triggers.accept:
Player: Can we agree on 15 bucks?
Salesman: thinking
Salesman: Let's do 20.
Player: Alright, sounds fair.

You receive ancient chest.
Inside the chest, you find a wooden totem. The moment you have a closer look at the totem, you notice you receive a message on your mobile phone.
Ahh, it's Professor Kraysee again!
triggers.fail: What are you doing? Maybe ask for the price first.
